intro: Sisymbrium simplicissimum, commonly known as sweet rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom from late spring to early summer. Sweet rocket is often found in disturbed soils and can be seen in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
